meanings.definition: (of a bird or mammal) Hatched or born in an advanced state and able to feed itself almost immediately.
meanings.sent1: The precocial ducklings quickly found food on their own.
meanings.sent2: The precocial chicks were already pecking at the ground just hours after hatching.
meanings.sent3: The precocial rabbit was so independent, it refused any help finding food.
meanings.sent4: Her precocial instincts kicked in, and she navigated the new environment effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The precocial fawn stood up and started grazing within minutes of being born.

meanings.definition: Having open eyes and the ability to move around shortly after birth.
meanings.sent1: The precocial kittens were exploring the room as soon as they opened their eyes.
meanings.sent2: The precocial puppies were already stumbling around the yard just days after being born.
meanings.sent3: The precocial baby was so curious, it started crawling around the house immediately.
meanings.sent4: His precocial vision allowed him to see the world clearly from the moment he was born.
meanings.sent5: The precocial foal was already trotting alongside its mother within hours of birth.
